qns.schedular package¶

Submodules¶

qns.schedular.entity module¶

class qns.schedular.entity.CallEvent(callee, simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: object, source=None, event: Optional[qns.schedular.event.Event] = None)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.event.Event

This event will call callee's handle function.

Parameters

  • callee -- the event's receiver

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg -- anything, can be considered as the event's parameters

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

run(simulator)¶

This function call self.callee's handle function.

class qns.schedular.entity.Entity(name=None)¶

Bases: object

Entity presents an entity in the network such as nodes, routers and links. It can also be used as a virtual entity such as a timer.

One or more Protocol's should be injected into a entity to implement certain components and functions.

Parameters

name -- the name of this entity. If name is None, a random uuid4 will be used.

add_subentity(entity)¶

Add a sub entity into this subentity.

Parameters

entity -- the sub entity

call(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: object, source=None, event: Optional[qns.schedular.event.Event] = None, time_slice=None)¶

call is an easy way to build an CallEvent and triggle itself's handle function in time_slice. When time_slice is None, the CallEvent will be called currently.

call function is used when event is not important.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg -- anything, can be considered as the event's parameters

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

get_subentity(name: str)¶

retrive a sub entity by its name.

Parameters

name (str) -- the name of this sub entity.

Returns

the sub entity or None

handle(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: object, source=None, event: Optional[qns.schedular.event.Event] = None)¶

handle is triggled by an Event. It traverses all the protocols to handle this event.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg -- anything, can be considered as the event's parameters

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

inject_protocol(protocol)¶

This function will inject one or more Protocol's into this entity.

Parameters

protocol -- A Protocol or a list of it.

install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

install is called before simulator runs, it initial injected Protocol's.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

qns.schedular.event module¶

class qns.schedular.event.Event(init_time: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: object

The class is the structure of an event.

Parameters

init_time -- the event's generation time in second

Variables

  • start_time -- the event's start time in second

  • end_time -- the event's end time in second

  • source -- the entity that triggle this event

cancel(*args, **kwargs)¶

It is the cancel function. If this function is implemented, the event can be canceled.

run(simulator)¶

It is the real event's handle functions. run should be overrided.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator.

start(simulator, start_time=None)¶

It is an inner function is called by simulator, it calles run to carry out actions.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • start_time -- the real event's start time

qns.schedular.pool module¶

class qns.schedular.pool.EventsPool(start_time_slice: int, end_time_slice: int)¶

Bases: object

A linked list for storing and processing event collections. This is an inner class that will not be exported.

Parameters

  • start_time_slice -- the start time slice

  • end_time_slice -- the end time slice

Variables

  • self.current (EventsPoolNode) -- point to the current event

  • self.current_time_slice -- the start time_slice of the current event

add_event(time_slice: int, event: qns.schedular.event.Event) → bool¶

This function add an event into this event pool

Parameters

  • time_slice -- the event's start time_slice

  • event -- the event to insert

Return bool

Insert event successfully or not

get_current_time_slice() → int¶

This function returns the start time_slice of the current event

Returns

the start time_slice of the current event

get_event()¶

This function get the current event and move current the current.next

Returns (int, event)

The current event's start time_slice and the current event itself.

remote_event(event)¶

This function remove an event from this event pool

Parameters

event -- the event to be removed

set_current_time_slice(current_time_slice: int)¶

This function set self.current_time_slice

Parameters

current_time_slice -- the current event time_slice

show_events()¶

This function print every events after self.current

class qns.schedular.pool.EventsPoolNode(time_slice: int, event: qns.schedular.event.Event)¶

Bases: object

cancel()¶

qns.schedular.protocol module¶

class qns.schedular.protocol.Protocol(entity)¶

Bases: object

Protocol defines a basic set of actions that an entity can do. install and handle are two functions that will be called to handle events

Parameters

entity (Entity) -- the entity that this protocol injected

handle(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: object, source=None, event=None)¶

handle is one of the callback functions that can be used to handle the triggered event.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg -- anything, can be considered as the event's parameters

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

install will be called before the simulator starts. It can be used to initialize or insert initial events.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

qns.schedular.simulator module¶

class qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator(start_time: float = 0.0, end_time: float = 600.0, time_accuracy: int = 1000, events_list=[])¶

Bases: object

Simulator: The simulator for quantum network.

Parameters

  • start_time -- simulate start time in second

  • end_time -- simulate end time in second

  • time_accuracy -- simulate time accuracy, eg: 1000, 1000000

add_event(time_slice: int, event: qns.schedular.event.Event)¶

Add an event into simulator event pool.

Parameters

  • time_slice -- event's start time in time_slice

  • event -- inserted event

remote_event(event: qns.schedular.event.Event)¶

Remove an event from simulator event pool.

Parameters

event -- removed event

run()¶

core function to run the simulate

setup(events_list)¶
to_time(time_slice: int) → float¶

Convert a time_slice to time

Parameters

time -- a time_slice

Returns

a time in second

to_time_slice(time: float)¶

Convert time to time_slice, change time from second into inner time sequence

Parameters

time -- a time in second

Returns

inner time_slice

exception qns.schedular.simulator.SimulatorError¶

Bases: Exception

Module contents¶

A discrete time schedular and a network simulator.
